page.title: 03THE FARMERS DAY IN WINTER
page.content: A TYPICAL WINTERS DAY ON THE FARM BEGINS AT 7.30. AFTER BREAKFAT THE CALVES ARE FED, WATERED AND BEDDED DOWN. LATER THE CORN IS GROUND. IN THE AFTERNOON THERE IS THE MAINTAINANCE OF THE BUILDINGS AND THE MACHINERY TO BE DONE. AT 3.30 THE CALVES AND THE OTHER ANIMALS ARE FED. {TIMETABLE OF JOBS 8.30 BREAKFAST 9.00 BEGIN FEEDING CALVES 11.30 CORN GRINDING 1.00_2.00 LUNCH 2.00 ODD JOBS ON THE FARM 3.30 CALF AND ANIMAL FEEDING 6.00 FINISH WORK THE WORK TO BE DONE ON THE LAND DURING THE WINTER INCLUDES PLOUGHING, CHAIN HARROWING AND FERTILISING THE LAND.
